Line widths set in IB

Removed width setting from code and set it in IB

Width for reference lines

The main line and the reference lines' width can now be set indepently. By default, the reference lines do have a width of <main line's width/2> to ensure backwards compatibility.
fixing quotaions mark for bridging header
Fixed issue where permanent pop up labels are duplicated when layoutSubview is called (i.e. during interface orientation changes)

Update README.md

Fixed typo
Modified the sample project to show some various new options that the framework supports. Some of these implementions are in comments as to not chance the behavior of the sample project too much.
Support null value interpolation in bezier curves
Adding a delay before the long press activates + adding back in the delegate to only allow horizontal pans
Adding a long press gesture to allow for initial popup display when interacting with the graph

Revert "Using touches began thru cancelled instead of using pan gesture recognizer for detecting touches and movement.  This allows popovers to initially show without needing to drag."

This reverts commit 6daaa32389da298b4e454f194e74cb205efb41d5.
Changing assign properties to weak for delegate and data source
Added graphing support for null values.  Additionally, when drawing nulls, an option was added to interpolate the value (to draw a line through the average of the surrounding values).
Using touches began thru cancelled instead of using pan gesture recognizer for detecting touches and movement.  This allows popovers to initially show without needing to drag.

Added a few features:
  Y Axis Position on right
  option to dot reference lines
  option to disable animation of dots
  Float values on the Y-Axis (Controlled by 'N' sized characters)
  Customizations to the no data label (Modify the color and font)
  Optional prefix and suffix for both the popup label as well as the Y-Axis
  Option to pass a custom popover view to generate a very custom popover

Merge pull request #55 from MobileHealth/master

Podname should be quoted

Y-Axis labels change

- The offset on the left of the graph for the Y-Axis labels is not
hardcoded anymore but of the size of the longest Y-Axis label.
- The text of the labels on the Y-Axis are now aligned to the right.

Added optional methods for max and min Yaxis values

`maxValueForLineGraph` and `minValueForLineGraph` are two new optional
methods used to manually set the maximum and minimum value of the
Y-Axis.
See #50 and #53.

Fixed issue when only tow labels are displayed on xAxis

The last label wasn't displayed at the right position when only two
labels were displayed and the Yaxis was enabled.

Fixed autoScaleYAxis property

The autoScaleYAxis property works again as expected.

Fixed exception with one point or less

Fixes issue #56.

Added property to change the color of the pop up label's background
Update README.md

Customization of touch input line & more

- To avoid confusion with the vertical reference lines, the line
displayed when the user touches the graph is now called "touch input
line" (was called vertical line before).
- Added property colorTouchInputLine to customize the color of the
touch input line
- Added property alphaTouchInputLine to customize the alpha of the
touch input line
- Added property widthTouchInputLine to customize the width of the
touch input line
- New method distanceToClosestPoint that calculates the distance
between the closest point and the user's touch input
- New method setColorTouchInputLine to dynamically set the color of the
touch input line
Update README.md

Remove overlapping labels is now optional

- New property `removeOverlappingLabelsOnAxis` making the feature that
automatically removes overlapping labels optional. See issue #30, point
3.

Option to always display some of the pop up labels

- New method `lineGraph:alwaysDisplayPopUpAtIndex` that gives the
option to always display some of the pop up labels. See issue #28.

Minor clean-up

- Got rid of `labelXaxisOffset`because it was not being used any more

Master branch catch up & fixes

- Catch up with Master branch (PR#39)
- New method `graphLabelsForXAxis` that returns all of the labels on
the XAxis
- The position of line for the frame is now dependent of the label size
- The padding for the graph is now dependent of the label size
- Fix animation duration

Merge branch 'release'

V2.0

    Deprecated some delegate methods and replaced with newer delegate methods with more parameters.
    Made some properties private.

New Features

    New delegate methods to specify line color and alpha.
    New delegate methods that notify the delegate when the graph starts and ends updates.
    Added new calculation methods to calculate the graph's sum, average, standard deviation, median, mode, and more.
    Added a new graph snapshot method which efficiently captures a UIImage of the graph.
    Updated Sample App to reflect new features and changes.
    Added pre-compiler check for the Objective-C Module Build Setting. Modules are used if enabled, otherwise traditional imports are used.
    Added a warning for projects without ARC.

Fixed Issues

    Added call to super in layoutSubviews.
    The reloadGraph method now calls setNeedsLayout instead of directly calling layoutSubviews.
    Improved memory performance with @autoreleasepool blocks.
    Added Type-Safety for 64-bit architecture.
    Fixed X-Axis layout issues.
    Fixed typos.
Fixed the way the bottom & top part of the graph are drawn with Bezier Curves

Update README.md

Added link to Gitter for support/discussions.

Update README.md

Added link to Gitter for support/discussions.
Added support of Bezier Curved Lines
Fixed typos in READNE.md

Optimized the way the labels are displayed on the X-Axis

The labels on the X-Axis are now offset to be centered if necessary and
possible.

Fixed issue #3 and #6

- Added exception to fix issue when only one point is drawn (issue #6).
- Added exception to fix issue when all of the points have the same
value (issue #3).
- Added define padding to replace hard coded number.

Thank you to @darkFunction for the help with the fix of issue #3.

Optimized the way the X-Axis labels are displayed.

The graph will now offset the labels on the X-Axis if needed and
possible in order for them to be centered.

A good example is with 12 points and a gap of 2:
- Before, the first label would be displayed on the 3rd point and the
last label was displayed on the last point.
- Now, all of the labels are shifted one row to the left so that the
first label is displayed on the second point and the last label on the
second to last point. This way, the labels appear centered on the
X-Axis.
